title: Which type of university is Mumbai University? - Quora

response.answer_text: In fact I am confused with this question and still I am trying to answer. Mumbai university provides various types of General Academic Courses, professional courses and technical courses. You can visit its website and check the list of courses. Now let's talk about the types of universities. Generally, as per my little information (not knowledge) any university is supposed to develop various types of courses and run them by own departments and affiliated colleges. The courses are related every field (subject) of life e.g. languages, arts, history, commerce, science, technology etc. etc. Some universities are for some specific/special purposes. E.g. Medical Sciences University at Nashik, Sanskrit university at Nagpur and Technical university at Lonere in Raigad district of Maharashtra. I would like to know from your good self the various types of universities.

Mumbai University is a STATE University. You can access its website on http://www.mu.ac.in/ Also note : In the Indian higher education sector, universities are classified into four types depending on the manner in which they were set up. These are central universities, state universities, deemed universities and private universities. Besides these four, there are institutes which are designated as institutes of national importance.
